description:
buildscript: drop the SIG prefix for trapped signals

The SIG prefix is optional for bash but
must not be present for pdksh (which is
what Plan 9's ape/psh is based on).

messages.text:
Akshat Kumar <akumar@mail.nanosouffle.net> once said:
> I think there is no need for this.  The buildscripts are generated by
> the ``go'' tool.  Changing them directly is perhaps not the best
> choice.  Moreover, most shells support the "SIG" prefix.
> 
> On Plan 9, Geoff has just updated the pdksh shell to support the
> prefix (do a replica/pull). ☺

Great!  Thanks for the notice.  Last time I
pulled from sources was before the holidays.

Cheers,
  Anthony

I think there is no need for this.  The buildscripts are generated by
the ``go'' tool.  Changing them directly is perhaps not the best
choice.  Moreover, most shells support the "SIG" prefix.

On Plan 9, Geoff has just updated the pdksh shell to support the
prefix (do a replica/pull). ☺


Best,
Akshat

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

subject: code review 5534052: buildscript: drop the SIG prefix for trapped signals
